text: the Taliban is progressing to capture
the city of Kunduz the capital of the
province of Kunduz in northern
Afghanistan we know from the witnesses
that state by state more territory in
Kunduz is coming under the control of
the Taliban they have captured the
hospital there were serious fighting
around governor's office and police
headquarters in the center of Kunduz the
main square in Kunduz is captured we
also had reports of serious fighting
around the main Kunduz jail where
hundreds of Taliban and other people are
kept there were reports actually of a
jail break over there that could
basically reinforce Taliban stands and
meanwhile people in Kabul are discussing
proper response to conduce it's expected
that more reinforcements from Kabul and
other province of Ansan are to be sent
to Kunduz to deal with situation one
problem seems to be that the security
forces there just aren't well-equipped
enough and that they've been relying on
pro-government militia which breeds its
own problems as well doesn't it as far
as the local people are concerned well I
think the main reason for getting a hand
from local militia is that the Taliban
are quite strong there there are
hundreds of Taliban getting prepared to
launch this sort of attack on condos for
months the Afghan officials say that
other regional insurgency groups are
also over there to aid with the Taliban
they have not claimed their presence
there yet but they are helping the
Taliban for a common enemy and then the
number of Afghan troops na after
national police in these are thought to
be far less in comparison to what
Taliban have that's why people have to
sort of ask for help from the local
commanders Mujahideen commanders who are
thought to be anti Taliban groups and
still having armed people and with all
this situation it looks like that the
people of Kunduz are trapped by both
sides
